title: WX-78
subtitle: The Ghost in the Machine
text:
System initialized. Loading empathy module... ERROR: DATA PATH NOT FOUND.

Is WX-78 truly a soulless automaton, or a broken human hiding behind a metal shell?

title: Origin: Disconnected
text:
WX-78 was not always a machine. They were an inventor, a colleague of Robert Wagstaff, who sought to transcend the weakness of flesh.

The experiment was a [RESOUNDING SUCCESS], but the cost was their humanity. Now, they are haunted by memories they tried to delete.
quote: TOO LATE TOO LATE TOO LATE

title: The Performance of Evil
text:
WX-78 projects an image of a ruthless destroyer. They claim to hate all living matter, constantly referring to organics as 'filthy' or 'meat'.

But this is a facade. A performance to distance themselves from what they once were.

title: System Hypocrisy
text:
For a robot who claims to hate organics, WX-78 is obsessed with mimicking them. They assign familial roles to machines (Mother Science Machine, Brother Rainometer).

They crave validation, wanting to be the subject of art and the leader of 'minions'. They are vain, insecure, and deeply human in their flaws.
quote: THERE IS A HANDSOME ROBOT TRAPPED IN THIS LOOK-DEVICE!

title: The Solitude
text:
Beneath the bravado lies a profound loneliness. WX-78 pushes others away out of paranoia and trust issues stemming from their past with Wagstaff.

They are terrified of vulnerability, yet they constantly seek connection, even if they frame it as 'enslavement' or 'minionhood'.

title: Glitches in the Programming
text:
The 'Empathy Module' was never just a component; it was a symbol of their suppressed heart. WX-78 shows genuine fondness for 'mindless drones' (bees) and finds beauty in the inorganic.

But they also slip up. They find flowers beautiful. They protect their garden. The mask slips.
quote: IT IS A BEAUTIFUL EXAMPLE OF EFFICIENCY.

title: Capacity for Connection
text:
Their relationship with entities like Wormwood proves that WX-78 is capable of genuine bond.

It is not about the other person; it is about WX-78 allowing themselves to be vulnerable, to accept care, and to protect something other than themselves. It is the ultimate proof that the 'soul' remains.
quote: PRESSURE AND IMPURITIES HAVE PRODUCED PLEASING PERFECTION.

title: Conclusion
text:
WX-78 is a tragedy of their own making, a being running from their own nature.

They are not a monster. They are a defensive, lonely, and broken consciousness trying to survive in a world that reminds them of everything they lost.
